BiblioData.Title: Manufacturing method of magnetic core - ceramic shell nanocrystals
BiblioData.Abstract: Provided are magnetic core - ceramic shell (e.g., magnetite (Fe 3 O 4 ) core - calcium phosphate (Ca 3 (PO 4 ) 2 ) shell) nanocrystals with high crystallization degree, uniform size, and high chemical stability and a method for synthesizing the same. A core-shell structure is synthesized in a process of forming magnetite seeds corresponding to cores by the reduction of magnetite precursors and then, sequentially, coating the magnetite with Ca 3 (PO 4 ) 2 by the reduction of Ca 3 (PO 4 ) 2 precursors.

Claims.P: 1. A method for manufacturing bifunctional magnetic core - ceramic shell nanocrystals in a sequential process, characterized in that the method comprises:
mixing magnetic core material precursors with a reducing agent for the core material precursors;
mixing the resultant with a solvent for the magnetic core material precursors and the reducing agent and forming a first mixture solution;
heating the first mixture solution to a first temperature and maintaining the first mixture solution for a first time;
cooling the first mixture solution to room temperature and forming magnetic core materials;
mixing the magnetic core materials with ceramic shell material precursors and a reducing agent for the ceramic shell material precursors and forming a second mixture solution;
heating the second mixture solution to a second temperature and maintaining the second mixture solution for a second time; and
cooling the second mixture solution to room temperature and coating the magnetic core materials with the ceramic shell materials.
2. The method of claim 1, characterized by further comprising: precipitating the bifunctional nanocrystals by the addition of ethanol and performing separation using a centrifugal separator.
3. The method of claim 1, characterized in that the forming of the first mixture solution further comprises adding a surfactant.
4. The method of claim 1, characterized in that the forming of the second mixture solution does not further comprise adding a surfactant.
5. The method of claim 1, characterized in that the core is magnetite (Fe3O4) and the shell is calcium phosphate (Ca3(PO4)2).
6. The method of claim 1, characterized by further comprising: after maintaining the first mixture solution at the first temperature for a predetermined time,
heating the first mixture solution to a third temperature higher than the first temperature and maintaining the first mixture solution for a third time.
7. The method of claim 1, characterized by further comprising: after maintaining the second mixture solution at the second temperature for a predetermined time,
heating the second mixture solution to a fourth temperature higher than the second temperature and maintaining the second mixture solution for a fourth time.
8. A method for manufacturing bifunctional magnetite-calcium phosphate (Ca3(PO4)2) core-shell nanocrystals in a sequential process, characterized in that the method comprises:
mixing magnetite precursors, Fe<III> (acac)3, with a reducing agent for the magnetite precursors;
mixing the resultant with dioctyl ether, a solvent, and forming a first mixture solution;
heating the first mixture solution to 300 deg. C and maintaining the first mixture solution for 1 to 2 hours;
cooling the first mixture solution to room temperature and forming magnetite cores;
mixing the magnetite cores with calcium acetate, ammonium phosphate, and reducing agents thereof and forming a second mixture solution;
heating the second mixture solution to 80 deg. C and maintaining the second mixture solution for 30 minutes; and
cooling the second mixture solution to room temperature and coating the magnetite cores with the calcium phosphate (Ca3(PO4)2) shells.
9. The method of claim 8, characterized by further comprising: precipitating the bifunctional nanocrystals by the addition of ethanol and performing separation using a centrifugal separator.

10. The method of claim 8, characterized in that the forming of the first mixture solution further comprises: adding tri-block copolymer (Poly(Ethylene Oxide) - Poly(Propylene Oxide) - Poly(Ethylene Oxide): PEO-PPO-PEO) as a surfactant.
11. The method of claim 8, characterized in that the forming of the second mixture solution does not further comprise: adding a surfactant.
12. Bifunctional magnetic core - ceramic shell nanocrystals manufactured in a sequential process, characterized in that the process comprises:
mixing magnetic core material precursors with a reducing agent for the core material precursors;
mixing the resultant with a solvent for the magnetic core material precursors and the reducing agent and forming a first mixture solution;
heating the first mixture solution to a first temperature and maintaining the first mixture solution for a first time;
cooling the first mixture solution to room temperature and forming magnetic core materials;
mixing the magnetic core materials with ceramic shell material precursors and a reducing agent for the ceramic shell material precursors;
mixing the resultant with a solvent for the ceramic shell material precursors and the reducing agent and forming a second mixture solution;
heating the second mixture solution to a second temperature and maintaining the second mixture solution for a second time; and
cooling the second mixture solution to room temperature and coating the magnetic core materials with ceramic shell materials.
13. Bifunctional magnetite-calcium phosphate (Ca3(PO4)2) core-shell nanocrystals manufactured in a sequential process, characterized in that the process comprises:
mixing magnetite precursors, Fe<III> (acac)3, with a reducing agent for the magnetite precursors;
mixing the resultant with dioctyl ether, a solvent, and forming a first mixture solution;
heating the first mixture solution to 60 deg. C to 80 deg. C and maintaining the first mixture solution for 1 to 2 hours;
cooling the first mixture solution to room temperature and forming magnetite cores;
mixing the magnetite cores with calcium acetate, ammonium phosphate, and reducing agents thereof and forming a second mixture solution;
heating the second mixture solution to 80 deg. C and maintaining the second mixture solution for 30 minutes; and
cooling the second mixture solution to room temperature and coating the magnetite cores with the calcium phosphate (Ca3(PO4)2) shells.
